original.name: Auxiliary Lux Scoop
original.body: After you ally with the offense, you may gain an amount of lux tokens equal to four minus the number of ships you sent. If you would gain exactly three lux tokens, gain one ultra lux token instead.

original.name: Bootleg Market
original.body: During your regroup phase, instead of retrieving a ship from the warp, you may gain one ultra lux token.

original.name: Bureaucrat
original.body: After the offense establishes a foreign colony, you may take one lux token from them.

original.name: Chronovizier
original.body:
When a player draws any number of cards from the deck, they may discard any number of those cards at a cost of 1 Lux per card. Then, they draw the same number of cards, but cannot use this ability again on these cards.

If another player resolves this effect, they pay that Lux to you.

original.name: Conservator
original.body:
Before cards are revealed, the defense may spend any amount of Lux to add 3 to either side's total for each Lux they spend.

If another player resolves this effect, they pay that Lux to you.

original.name: Defector Recruiter
original.body: As an ally, after alliances are formed, you may choose an ally on the other side that is not already on the targeted planet. Pay that player one ultra lux token to force that player to return their ships to their colonies.

original.name: Double Ultra Luxurious Lifestyle
original.body: As any player except the offense, when you buy rewards using Lux, if you pay with at least one ultra lux token, gain two additional rewards.

original.name: Evacuator
original.body: If you are not the offense, after cards are selected but before they are revealed, you may spend one ultra lux token to remove all of any player's ships from the encounter, if that player has given you their permission.

original.name: Flare Access
original.body:
You may spend 5 Lux to resolve this effect; or another player can pay you 3 Lux to resolve this effect:

Draw two flares from the unused flare deck. Add one to your hand and shuffle the other back into the unused flare deck.

original.name: Garbage Sifter
original.body:
Before a player draws a new hand, they may spend 2 Lux to choose one card in the discard pile and draw it as the first card of their new hand.

If another player resolves this effect, they pay that Lux to you.

original.name: Immunizer
original.body: At the start of a player's turn, you may spend one ultra token to choose any one alien power. That power cannot be canceled by any effect for the rest of the encounter.

original.name: Landlord
original.body: At the start of your turn, each player with a foreign colony in your home system must either pay you 1 Lux or send one of their ships in your system to the warp.

original.name: Liberator
original.body: During your regroup phase, you may spend one ultra lux token to free all of one player's ships from the warp, if that player has given you their permission.

original.name: Liquefier
original.body:
As the defense, before cards are selected, you may spend any amount of Lux to discard one card from your hand for each Lux you spend.

If you are not the defense, before cards are played, the defense may pay you 1 Lux to discard one card from their hand.

original.name: Liquidation Sale
original.body: When a player draws a new hand, for each non-encounter card they had to discard, gain one lux token.

original.name: Lux Skimmer
original.body: After another player gains at least 3 Lux or at least 1 ultra lux token, you may take one lux token from that player, if able.

original.name: Palm Greaser
original.body: During a deal, you may spend one ultra lux token. Both main players may establish one more colony than normal as part of this deal.

original.name: Patron
original.body:
As an ally, after encounter cards are revealed, you may spent any amount of Lux to add 3 to either side's total for each Lux you spend.

If you are not a main player or ally, after cards are revealed, each ally may pay you 1 Lux to add 3 to either side's total.

original.name: Pillager
original.body: After the defense collects lux tokens, if you won as the offense, take one lux token from the defense for each of your ships that landed on the targeted planet.

original.name: Reassurance Agent
original.body:
You may pay 2 Lux to resolve this effect, or another player can pay you 2 Lux for them to resolve this effect:

Before a player would collect compensation, double the amount of compensation that player collects.

original.name: Stealth Device
original.body:
Before a player discards cards or has cards taken from their hand, they may spend any amount of Lux to set aside one card from their hand for each Lux they spend. These set-aside cards return to their hand after the effect is resolved.

If another player resolves this effect, they pay that Lux to you.

original.name: Sticky Digits
original.body: After any player plays an artifact (including you), you may spend one ultra lux token to return that card to the player's hand instead of discarding it. That artifact cannot be played again during this incounter.

original.name: Surge Protector
original.body: After a player plays an artifact with "Zap" in its name, gain 3 Lux.

original.name: Trading Halt
original.body: At the start of another player's turn, you may spend one ultra lux token to prevent all players from being able to spend Lux for the rest of this encounter
